item.title: Vietnam to Pay 20% Tariff on Exports to US, Trump Says
item.description: President Donald Trump says the US reached a trade deal with Vietnam after weeks of intense talks. A 20% tariff will be placed on Vietnamese exports to the US, with a 40% levy on any goods deemed to be transshipped through the country, Trump said in a social-media post on Wednesday. Trump said that Vietnam had agreed to drop all levies on US imports. Bloomberg's Kailey Leinz has the breaking news from Washington on "Bloomberg Open Interest." (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Mineral Smuggling From Congo to Rwanda at ‘Unprecedented Levels’, UN Says
item.description: Mineral smuggling from eastern Democratic Republic of Congo into neighboring Rwanda has reached “unprecedented levels” amid the occupation of a large swath of the region by Rwanda-backed M23 rebels, according to a United Nations experts report.
